\newcommand{\myTFquestion}[3]{%
\begin{minipage}{7.5cm}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\textbf{#1} \\
\indent \textbf {} #2 \textbf {} #3
\end{minipage}
}

\item \textbf{#1} \\
\par
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\indent True \hspace{0.5cm} False\\%
\vspace{-0.2cm}
}%

\newcommand\SpecifyBlock[1][]{%
	\parbox[t][14.6cm][t]{8.5cm}{%
	\begin{description}
  \setkeys{TFQuestions}{#1}%
	\end{description}
	}
	\vspace{-0.2cm}
}

\newcommand{\myshortquestion}[5]{%
\begin{minipage}{7.5cm}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\textbf{#1} \\
\indent \textbf {} #2 \textbf {} #3 \textbf {} #4 \textbf {} #5
\end{minipage}
}

\newcommand{\myquestion}[4]{%
\begin{minipage}{7.5cm}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\textbf{#1}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\begin{description}
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\item [a] #2
\vspace{-0.2cm}
\item [b] #3
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\item [c] #4
\vspace{-0.1cm}
\end{description}
\end{minipage}
}

\begin{textblock}{8}(8,0)
\textblocklabel{picture8,0}
\begin{tiny}Cultural differences on saying 'no'\end{tiny}\\\SpecifyBlock[
Question1 = {1. Chen thought Smith changed his mind about the plan.},
Question2 = {2. Smith thought Chen changed his mind about the plan.},
Question3 = {3. Both Smith and Chen changed their minds about the plan.},
Question4 = {4. Chen has more power in the relationship than Smith.},
Question5 = {5. Smith is Chen's boss.},
Question6 = {6. Smith and Chen are probably businessmen involved in a joint venture in China.},
Question7 = {7. Smith and Chen  probably have an interest in how the other person sees the situation.},
Question8 = {8. Chen probably knows a lot about the problems of talking with Westerners.},
Question9 = {9. Smith probably doesn't have much experience doing business in Asia.},
]\par
\vspace{-0.2cm}
\end{textblock}
